headline: Safety and Occupational Health Specialist at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
summary:
A retired veteran of the US Marine Corps and a Certified Safety and Health Specialist through Eastern Kentucky University. A graduate of the Joint Services Safety and Health Course (CP-12) at Ft Rucker, AL, Respiratory Protection Program Manager trainer and an OSHA Outreach Trainer.
     Currently an Occupational Safety Specialist with the US Immigration and Enforcement Office of Safety and Health.

defaultPosition.description: Facility inspections and Safety Program Audits for ICE locations in the US.
defaultPosition.title: Safety and Occupational Health Specialist

positions.description: Facility inspections and Safety Program Audits for ICE locations in the US.
positions.title: Safety and Occupational Health Specialist

positions.companyName: Headquarters and Headquarters Squadron MCAS Beaufort
positions.description: Perform all manner of duties that impact on personal, recreational and occupational safety and health. Perform scheduled and unscheduled inpsections of facilities and safety programs to gauge effectiveness. Perform root cause analysis of MISHAPs to mitigate risks to personnel and equipment. Provide training to individuals in all aspects of safety to improve the command safety culture.
positions.title: Ground Safety Manager

positions.companyName: Marine All Weather Fighter Attack Squadron 224 (VMFA(AW)-224)
positions.description: Performed duties as the Powerplants and Fuel System Specialist Section and Division Manager in a US Marine aviation squadron. Responsible for transitioning the squadron from a paper based training management system to a fully web based system known as Advanced Skills Management (ASM). Deployed to many diverse and austere environments and performed duties to support a flight schedule in stressful situations.
positions.title: Section and Division Manager

positions.description: Performed duties as the Powerplants and Fuel System Specialist Section and Division Manager in a US Marine aviation squadron. Concurrently peroformed as a Quality Assurance Representative, HAazarous Materials Coordinator and the Safety manager for a 12 aircraft unit. Deployed to many diverse and austere environments and performed duties to support a flight schedule in stressful situations.
positions.title: Section and Division Manager, Quality Assurance Representative, HAZMAT Coordinator, Safety Maager

positions.companyName: Marine All Weather Fighter Attack Squadron 533 (VMFA(AW)-533)
positions.description: Performed inspections on aircraft and programs to ensure safety of flight for aircraft. Ensured safety procedures were followed on and around the flightline area.
positions.title: Quality Assurance Representative

positions.description: Performed both static and mobile patrol throughout two US Embassies, Croatis and Panama. Ensured proper handling of classified material, protection of personnel and Embassy grounds.
positions.title: Marine Security Guard/Watchstander

positions.companyName: Marine All Weather Fighter Attack Squadron 332 (VMFA(AW)-332)
positions.description: Performed as a plane captain on F/A-18 Aircraft.Performed aircraft inspections, scheduled and unscheduled maintenance procedures and routine tasks such as fueling and towing of aircraft.
positions.title: Plane Captain
